2.1 Question 1

library(foreach)
library(knitr)

 x <- foreach(i = 1:100, .combine = rbind) %do% {
    samp <-  rexp(100,1)
    mean <- mean(samp)
    variance <- var(samp)
    
    c(mean, variance)
 }
 x_df <- as.data.frame(x)
colnames(x_df) <- c("Mean", "Variance")
kable(x_df)

3 Question 2

library(doParallel)
Loading required package: iterators
Loading required package: parallel
library(MASS)


cl <- makeCluster(3)
registerDoParallel(cl)

boot.sample <- matrix(0, nrow = 1000)
time1 <- system.time({
  y <- foreach(j = 1: 1000, .combine = c, .packages = 'MASS') %dopar% {
  
  sampl <- sample(galaxies, size = 82, replace = TRUE)
  sample_median <- median(sampl)
  boot.sample[j] = sample_median
}
})
stopCluster(cl)
cat("Parallel time:",time1)
Parallel time: 0.27 0.09 0.47 NA NA
#Parallel Processing time
time2 <- system.time({
  result <- foreach ( j = 1:1000) %do% {
    
  sampl <- sample(galaxies, size = 82, replace = TRUE)
  sample_median <- median(sampl)
  boot.sample[j] = sample_median
  
  }
})
cat("serial time:",time2)
serial time: 0.24 0.02 0.25 NA NA

4 Question 3

library(foreach)
library(doParallel)

set.seed(1)
n <- 50
mean.1 <- 1
B <- 1000

# Set up parallel backend
numCores <- makeCluster(3)  # Use all but one core
registerDoParallel(numCores)

# Perform the bootstrap using foreach
count <- foreach(i = 1:B, .combine = '+') %do% {
  u <- rexp(n, rate = 1)  # Generate random sample
  bstr <- replicate(B, mean(sample(u, replace = TRUE)))  # Bootstrap samples
  c1 <- quantile(bstr, c(0.025, 0.975))
  
  # Check if the true mean is within the interval
  if (c1[1]<= mean.1 && mean.1 <= c1[2]) {
     return(1)
  }
  else {
    return(0)
  }
}

# Calculate coverage probability
coverage <- count / B
# Stop the cluster
stopCluster(numCores)

# Print result

cat("Estimated coverage:",coverage)
Estimated coverage: 0.936

5 Question 4

library(foreach)

set.seed(1234)
result <- foreach(i = 1:3) %do% {
  it <- irnorm(5)
  nextElem(it)
  nextElem(it)
  nextElem(it)
  nextElem(it)
  nextElem(it)

}

for (i in 1:3) {
  maxi <- max(result[[i]])
  cat("Max for sample",i,":",maxi, "\n")
}
Max for sample 1 : 0.4595894 
Max for sample 2 : -0.49685 
Max for sample 3 : 2.070271

6 Question 5

library(parallel)

seed <- set.seed(1234)
result <- function() {
  it <- irnorm(5)
  nextElem(it)
  nextElem(it)
  nextElem(it)
  nextElem(it)
  nextElem(it)
}

# For the foreach
time11 <- system.time({
result1 <- foreach(i = 1:3) %do% {
  result()
}

for (i in 1:3) {
  maxi <- max(result1[[i]])
  cat("Max for sample",i,":",maxi, "\n")
}
})
Max for sample 1 : 0.4595894 
Max for sample 2 : -0.49685 
Max for sample 3 : 2.070271 
cat("time for the foreach loop:",time11)
time for the foreach loop: 0.02 0 0.02 NA NA
#For the parLapply
cl <- makeCluster(3)
clusterExport(cl, "result")
invisible(clusterEvalQ(cl, library(iterators)))
 # Setting the seed for parLapply
set.seed(1234)
time22 <- system.time({
parL <- parLapply(cl, 1:3, function(i){
  result()

})

for (i in 1:3) {
  maxi <- max(parL[[i]])
  cat("Max for sample",i,":",maxi, "\n")
}
})
Max for sample 1 : 0.4272016 
Max for sample 2 : 0.8933405 
Max for sample 3 : 0.8269572 
cat("time for parLappy:",time22)
time for parLappy: 0.02 0 0 NA NA
stopCluster(cl)

# for replicate
set.seed(1234)
time33 <- system.time({
result2 <- replicate(n = 3, result())

for (i in 1:3) {
  maxi <- max(result2[,i])
  cat("Max for sample",i,":",maxi, "\n")
}
})
Max for sample 1 : 0.4595894 
Max for sample 2 : -0.49685 
Max for sample 3 : 2.070271 
cat("time for replicate:",time33)
time for replicate: 0 0 0 NA NA
